items.title: Live: Nifty braces for fourth straight week of losses | IndusInd Bank, ITC In Focus | Opening Bell
items.description: Indian equity market remained rangebound for another session with the Nifty closing slightly below the 24,400 mark. Benchmarks extended southward journey for the fourth consecutive day. Market is poised for a fourth straight week of losses amid weak earnings and persistent FII selloff. Among stocks to watch today, ITC, IndusInd Bank will be in focus post Q2 earnings. Coal India, JSW Steel, Indigo, BPCL, BoB, HPCL, Shriram Finance are among the companies to watch out for today. We also focus on insurance stocks post their recent underperformance. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Raja Venkatraman, Co-Founder, NeoTrader and Siddarth Bhamre, Institutional Research Head - ACMIIL (Asit C Mehta Investment Interrmediates).

items.description: Diversification drives top-line growth, but inflationary pressure hurts margins.

items.title: Brokerages cheer for ITC stock after Q2 earnings smoke expectations amid challenging market
items.description: ITC Q2FY25 results have left analysts impressed. The company's net profit, revenue increased YoY, driven by robust cigarette volumes and a thriving hotel business, despite facing some economic headwinds.

items.title: IndusInd Bank stock nosedives 15% as Q2 results disappoint; brokerages remain bullish
items.description: IndusInd Bank stock plunged 15 percent in early deals as Q2 earnings disappointed. The counter has fallen around 32 percent so far this year, underperforming Nifty's returns of 12 percent.

items.title: L&T shares fall 2% as UBS downgrades to 'neutral' citing near term hurdles
items.description: The international broking firm suggests that even as core earnings remain supportive, it is anticipated there could likely be a slowdown in new order growth

items.title: NTPC shares fall 3% despite Q2 results beating Street estimates; PSU stock outruns Nifty YTD
items.description: NTPC shares dropped over 3 percent despite reporting a 14 percent YoY rise in consolidated net profit to Rs 5,380 crore for Q2FY25, alongside an interim dividend approval of Rs 2.5 per share.

items.title: 360 ONE Wealth posts strong Q2, best proxy for rising affluent class
items.description: Management gave clarity on the key concerns that include exit of Anirudha Taparia, co-founder and co-CEO, the fall in retention rates and a scenario of equity markets staying flat or drifting downwards

items.title: Afcons Infrastructure IPO: Should investors bet on it?
items.description: The company has a strong parentage, rich experience, and follows the best risk management practices in the construction industry. Those investors wanting a long-term exposure in an EPC pure-play can consider the offering.

items.title: IndusInd Bank no more in league of India's 10 most valuable lenders
items.description: The IndusInd Bank stock dropped 18 percent to hit over one-year low of Rs 1,065. As its m-cap went down to Rs 81,000 crore, it moved to the 12th spot

items.title: Bank stocks under pressure as lenders flag stress in MFI portfolio, weaker asset quality
items.description: Apart from IndusInd Bank, Kotak Mahindra, RBL Bank, and AU Small Finance Bank have reported stress in their asset quality, with significant increase in bad loans driven by stress in credit card and microfinance loans
